entry.title: Antimonumento 5J (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Antimonumento 5J (pictured) was installed on 5 June 2023 to commemorate victims of police repression during the 2020 protests in response to the death of Giovanni López?

entry.title: Don Johnson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cypress College basketball coach Don Johnson, who was an All-American at UCLA, developed two players with minimal experience who later played for his alma mater and set records in the NBA?

entry.title: one of SZA's songs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one of SZA's songs name-drops such figures as a boxer, a stand-up comedian, and Jesus?

entry.title: Shushu/Tong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shushu/Tong is a brand that creates fashion collections inspired by magical girl anime such as Puella Magi Madoka Magica?

entry.title: Peter Demetz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Peter Demetz, who taught German literature at Yale University from 1956 to 1991, was born in Prague where he was persecuted under the Nazis and escaped the Communist regime in 1949?

entry.title: Herschel the sea lion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Herschel the sea lion was defended by Greenpeace?

entry.title: Lin Yu-tang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Taiwanese long jumper Lin Yu-tang qualified for the 2024 Summer Olympics by switching out his broken track shoes between attempts?

entry.title: Yuba County's library (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Yuba County's library was built in 1906, it had a smoking room?

entry.title: Hevearita Gunaryanti Rahayu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a municipal purchase of 177 motorcycles by Hevearita Gunaryanti Rahayu, the mayor of Semarang, Indonesia, caused a social media controversy due to media misreporting?
